metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0659 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle MySQL 5.7.11 and earlier allows local users to affect availability via vectors related to Optimizer.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0659` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.12-0ubuntu1
mysql-client - 5.7.12-0ubuntu1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.12-0ubuntu1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.12-0ubuntu1
mysql-common - 5.7.12-0ubuntu1
mysql-server - 5.7.12-0ubuntu1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.12-0ubuntu1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.12-0ubuntu1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.12-0ubuntu1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.12-0ubuntu1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.12-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.12-0ubuntu1').
percona-server-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
